data.title: Package Manager should Hide Incompatible Packages

milestone.title: v2.0
milestone.description: "Coming Soon" Stuff that would introduce too many or too severe breaking changes to be released in anything less than a major version step.

data.body:
With the development and release of v2.0, the first major breaking change update since switching to the Package Management solution, nudging new users towards using the "right" packages will be a big challenge.

In order to improve this, the Package Manager should - by default, yet optionally - hide all packages that are unlikely to be compatible.
- Packages that are already installed will always be shown.
- Packages with unlikely compatibility level will be hidden.

Hiding packages can be implemented on the View-side of the UI.

data.title: Improve Font Kerning

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Duality's Kerning algorithm is less-than-optimal in some cases. This issue serves as a list of Font samples where Kerning behaves badly:
- [OpenSans Regular](http://www.google.com/fonts#UsePlace:use/Collection:Open+Sans), Size 8, Non-Monospace, Sample text "small".

data.title: Components on inactive game objects can be initialized twice

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Hello

I don't think this is expected behaviour. To reproduce:
1. Programatically add an inactive game object to the current scene
2. Notice that all components of the game object that implement ICmpInitializable have their OnInit methods called.
3. Now activate the game object. All initializable components will be initialized again.

I guess the solution to this, if its not intended behaviour, is to check whether the new game object is active before calling OnActivate in Scene.OnGameObjectAdded. We probably won't make that change locally as we can't be 100% sure what else it will break.

data.title: Creating new project from "Current Project" results in errors on build.

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Create a new project and select "Current Project" as the project source option; when you first build the new project, you'll encounter two related errors (note that this is the only way to generate the error; it doesn't occur if you create a new project by selecting "Empty Project").
- `Error 1`
  `The best overloaded method match for 'Duality.ReflectionHelper.ResolveType(string, System.Reflection.MethodInfo)' has some invalid arguments`
  `File: ...\EmptyTest\Source\Code\CorePlugin\Properties\ErrorHandlers.cs`
  `Line: 25 Col: 38`
  `Project: CorePlugin`
- `Error 2`
  `Argument 2: cannot convert from 'bool' to 'System.Reflection.MethodInfo'`
  `File: ...\EmptyTest\Source\Code\CorePlugin\Properties\ErrorHandlers.cs`
  `Line: 25 Col: 80`
  `Project: CorePlugin`

I have tested this using Duality version (Core: 1.6.2; Editor: 1.3.12 -- A fresh download), compiled against .NET 4.0 in VS 2013.

This doesn't appear to be a show stopping bug, as I've gotten it to compile and run by simply deleting the erroneous `false` argument in the call to ReflectionHelper.ResolveType. I haven't actually done any testing past making sure the editor launches properly, so this may cause issues down the road.

data.title: Sandbox bug
data.body: That one is a really annoying bug. In my game new objects are generated from prefabs every 2 seconds. It works ok in sandbox, but when I press stop, objects still continue to be generated. Eventually it will lead Dualitor to crash. because there will be far too many game objects.

data.title: Error when importing two fonts of the same family

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Following the conversation [here](http://forum.adamslair.net/viewtopic.php?f=20&t=372#p2026), I made a couple tests and I found that if you import a font inside Duality, remove the font, then try to import the same font or even another in the same family, Duality will refuse to import the file with a generic "file type not supported" error message.

(for this test I have used 'Arial Black' and 'Arial Italic' from the Windows' Font directory)
How to reproduce:
- Open a fresh copy of Duality
- Import (drag and drop) Arial Black in the project. The font will be imported.
- Remove Arial Black from the project.
- Import Arial Italic in the project. It won't work and you will get the error.

Restarting the editor fixes the issue, until you do it again :)

data.title: Dual monitor crash

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body: I think I've stumbled across a bug. The problem is that when I have a Game View open on my second monitor, and then restart Duality, it crashes. It works fine when I have only 1 monitor enabled.

data.title: Available Gamepads aren't enumerated correctly

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.title: Cap Framerate in the Editor Sandbox to ~ 60 FPS

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
- When entering Sandbox mode, the framerate isn't capped at all. This will yield unnecessarily high CPU and GPU cost.
- There should be a Default-On option to cap editor framerate to 60 FPS, in case it exceeds.
- This should only apply to the Sandbox mode to keep the editor more responsive while editing, as it won't do continuous updates and rendering in that mode anyway.

data.title: Allow PropertyGrid to Create Generics of Undefined <T>

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
- Right now, the Object Inspector can edit any List<T>, but is only able to create one when T is pre-defined.
- There should be a UI for manually selecting T when creating a new List<T> without knowing what T could be. It also should pop up when T can be derived from previous elements in a list, but isn't strictly bound to be exactly one Type.
- Generics should show up in the generalized create object dialog.

data.title: Don't display the License Agreement Dialog for Package Restore operations

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body: Right now, users have to re-agree to third-party package licenses when merely re-installing or restoring previously installed packages. This behavior should be fixed. License agreements should only be displayed when installing or updating a package, not when re-installing or restoring it.

data.title: Set default workspace directory
data.body: Maybe have something like Eclipse has, that sets the default workspace. Or something like Visual Studio.

data.body: In my game I have lots of situations where I need to use triggers. For example if a player goes through a trigger, then some events happen. I think that would be a really nice feature to have, especially for platformers

data.title: Investigate Collision Issue

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
As stated [here](http://forum.adamslair.net/viewtopic.php?f=4&t=388), there may be an issue with collision events in certain situations. Investigate.

Message from @SirePi with the details and repro case:

> To make it trigger, just left click on Test2, then left click on Test1.
> 
> You will see that all the ships currently in Test2 will instantly end in Test1 pool. Conversely, if you start from Test1 and send a fleet to Test2, you will see that the fleet actually travels to get there.
> 
> The collision code is in FleetComponent.cs OnCollisionBegin (there should be a breakpoint already there).

The test case download is here: https://www.dropbox.com/s/2hwju0om46u7jf1/BrokenGalaxy_Test.7z?dl=0

If you create a New Empty project from an already existing project, all plugins present in Plugins directory will be copied over to the new one (including external and game plugin dlls)

I would expect it to contain only the basic Duality ones.

Sorry for opening issues so fast...

When trying to edit the source code by pressing the `Open Sourcecode` button, an error dialog appears giving the error in the title of this issue. There is nothing interesting in the two log files I know of.

Does Duality support VS 2013?

data.title: OpenTK Loads SDL From PATH (Editor Crash)

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
After seeing Duality and reading the getting started guide, I decided to download it and try it out. The first time starting `DualityEditor.exe` it seemingly succeeds with download some packages, but then nothing happens. Upon restarting it, a splash screen is shown for less than half a second, a process is started, and then the splash screen disappears but the process remains active.

I've the .net framework installed and am using VS Express 2013 for desktop.

data.title: Use C# Unions for Combined Vector Fields?

milestone.title: v2.0
milestone.description: "Coming Soon" Stuff that would introduce too many or too severe breaking changes to be released in anything less than a major version step.

data.title: DrawDevice Abstraction Layer

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
- Picking is currently hard-wired into DrawDevice. 
- Remove it from there and instead create a DrawDevice wrapper class applying Picking stuff when being passed as IDrawDevice itself.
- This would pave the road to similar classes for implementing debug views in the editor, such as "Overdraw", "Untextured", "Wireframe" or similar - simply by modifying incoming drawcalls before passing them on to the "real" thing.

data.title: PlaneRenderer Component

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Displaying a partially-infinite, looping, scrolling background is a recurring problem. Provide a specialized standard Component for this along with the SpriteRenderer.
## Properties
- SharedMaterial
- CustomMaterial
- Offset
- AlignToPixelGrid
- ColorTint
- VisibilityGroup
- Rect: Offset and Measurements of the non-infinite sides
- InfiniteDirection: None, Horizontal, Vertical, Both
- ScrollOffset: Vector2 describing the UV offset in [0.0 ... 1.0] at unscaled Z
## Behavior
- Non-Infinite sides always "stretch" instead of "repeating".
- Should properly use Z sorting and parallax tranformation.
- Should properly interact with rotated Camera and rotated objects.

This issue requires further discussion and concept work before implementing a solution.

data.title: Investigate OpenTK Gamepad Support

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body: Due to [Gamepad issues](http://forum.adamslair.net/viewtopic.php?f=4&t=367), which are likely fixed in the newest OpenTK version, an upgrade would be a good idea.

data.title: Consider Moving Editor away from WinForms?

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: New systems and modules requiring a significant amount of long-term effort.

data.body:
**Original Title:** Consider Moving Editor to WPF?

As the title says - this should be considered in the future. Not an actual plan, but a rough idea for long term development.

Pro:
- Getting rid of the decade old WinForms cruft.
- Shiny new UI with styling capabilities.
- Fully hardware accelerated rendering performance.
- DPI independent rendering.
- XAML and Data Binding seems really, really neat.

Con:
- Rewriting all editor UI code.
- Rewriting the custom PropertyGrid.
- Searching WPF equivalents for Docking, fast / virtualized TreeViews, etc.
- Fully hardware accelerated rendering - does it interact with OpenGL performance, and can it host OpenTK GLControls? Is there any OpenTK support?
- Startup performance.
- "Never change a running system".
- A big change that isn't really necessary to advance Duality.

Not sure whether this is a good idea at all. So far it doesn't look very good, but opinions are welcome.

data.title: Changing Time.TimeScale affecting movement in Editor

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Create a component that sets Time.TimeScale to something say 3.5f. 
### Expected Result

Change doesn't affect editor at all.
### Actual Result

Moving in editor is really fast, also zooming and rotating becomes quick and stiff.

data.title: Package Installation is Order-Dependent

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
As discovered [here](http://forum.adamslair.net/viewtopic.php?f=16&t=359), the order in which packages are defined in `PackageConfig.xml` matters when installing packages, and can lead to errors in certain cases. This should not be fixed.
## Solution A
- Make sure the packages are sorted properly within the config file.
- Problem: Users can re-arrange this and scramble the setup. This is counter-intuitive and should not happen.
## Solution B
- Make sure the packages are installed in the proper order, regardless of config file ordering.

data.title: Provide Declarative Editor Window Interface

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
## Problem
- In the current EditorPlugin implementation scheme, the plugin explicitly tells the editors main form to create some menu entries.
- This requires all EditorPlugins to rely on AdamsLair.WinForms, as soon as they provide a new window.
- Changing method interfaces in AdamsLair.WinForms can break plugins that way.
## Solution
- Become more Declarative.
- Introduce an attribute to declare a menu item for a class deriving from DockContent.
- Let the editors main window take care of this itself. No plugin-side interaction required.

data.title: fixed English misspelling of 'resource'
data.body: I believe 'ressource' is the French spelling. This change is for consistency.
